content: [juno]
[juno] And behind us is a sudden drop.
[juno] And if something goes wrong here, I need to be certain one of us makes it back alive.
[juno] And they used them to kill each other.
[juno] Bellower is both immortal and beyond my influence. To a point.
[juno] But it will sow doubt in his mind.
[juno] Do you know of the god Stravhs? Few know this stone exists, even amongst those who have lived their whole lives in Boersgard.
[juno] Everyone who fights at your side must believe it to be true.
[juno] Eyvind must keep Boersgard from falling while we are away.
[juno] First we must make the arrow. Focus on the task at hand.
[juno] For all our knowledge it always seems as though we know little.
/=Juno gets a far away look in her eyes.=/
[juno] I apologize for putting you in danger.
[juno] I cannot say.
[juno] I can understand your apprehension, though.
[juno] I have my suspicions. But until I've had time at the mender libraries it would be unwise to speculate.
[juno] I learned the talent to heal minds, not control them. Though even some Valka have trouble believing this.
[juno] Indeed. You'll need to dislodge at least a fist-full of the metal.
[juno] I saw the thoughts of each person when I arrived at Boersgard. You were the only one I knew would return.
[juno] It is also our weakness. The Valka pass on and lose their knowledge, while the Sundr simply grow older and more powerful.
[juno] It's ok. You can speak. Softly.
[juno] I wish we'd had time for a proper introduction.
[juno] Maybe they see him as a patron, or it is an attraction they cannot explain.
[juno] My name is Juno. I am on the Mender council. You've met Eyvind, my apprentice.
[juno] No. Someday he will awaken and realize he's not dead. I imagine he will be quite upset.
[juno] No, that is not all it takes. What I tell you now must not be repeated.
[juno] No. The dredge cannot see us.
[juno] Rook, I am not certain how the dredge will react when you do this.
[juno rook] On the contrary, the less people know, the more certain they tend to be.
[juno rook] The god of secrets will play a part, as will you.
[juno] See the silver in the stone? The gales up here wear away the stone, but the metal remains.
/=Juno smiles. What could have come across as profoundly creepy looks sincere, instead.=/
[juno] So, be careful.
[juno] Some of us still practice the teachings given to the Loom-mother's first creations.
[juno] Taking control of Bellower... it is the difference between convincing a child to sit still and telling a starving bear to stop being hungry.
[juno] The arrow will not kill Bellower, even were it to strike his heart. He has no physical weaknesses.
[juno] The god Stravhs is wreathed by imagery of silver weapons. The myths say he traded these weapons to the gods.
[juno] The rest of you will convince him of it with sword and axe.
[juno] The truth is, we're rarely a match for the Sundr any more. Our advantage is that we can train more Valka.
[juno] They seem to be drawn to the godstone. There are many things we don't know about Stravhs.
[juno] Those who seek out the stone call him the god of trade. The menders call him the god of secrets. He was both.
[juno] To be more precise, they can see us, but I've convinced them to be unconcerned.
/=Juno waits patiently for your reply.=/

content.option: What are we doing out here?
Why are we surrounded by dredge?
Let's get what we need and go.

content: [juno] We are called Valka. I believe I am the only one who can influence another's mind.
[juno] We need a piece of this silver.
[juno] We're at the godstone of Stravhs.
[juno] We will forge it into an arrow to slay Bellower.
[juno] When it pierces him, I will help him to believe that he is dying.
[juno] While Denglr deals in fortune, Stravhs taught men the value of trade in a different way. He showed them it has consequence. Two sides of the same coin.
[juno] You are right. Menders do these things.
[juno] You would find your way back to Alette no matter what.
[rook] Does Stravhs have something to do with that serpent in Einartoft? What was that thing?
[rook] How are you doing these things? Controlling minds? I thought menders built things and healed wounds.
[rook] Imagine how the rest of us feel.
[rook] Is this where you're going to sacrifice me?
[rook juno] Can't?
[rook juno] What do you mean?
[rook juno] You're going to trick him into thinking he's dead. That is the most insane... he really can't be killed?
[rook] Make a magic arrow to shoot Bellower? That's all it takes? Why didn't you do that a long time ago?
[rook] Then how do we stop him?
[rook] Then why not take control of Bellower?
[rook] Wait, after everything you've told me...
[rook] Why didn't you take Eyvind? Or Hakon? You don't even know me.
/=She looks knowingly at the godstone, waiting for you to start climbing.=/
{skip} mark1=rook mark2=juno
/=You glance nervously around, but the dredge didn't seem to hear her.=/
